title: [BUG] `test_fit_idempotent()` failing to produce 'equal' results to the required degree of accuracy for DL estimators
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
First found during #3425, this bug causes failures as the idempotent property of estimators seems to be violated. This results in a bunch of `AssertionError`s only for DL estimators. I conducted a diagnostic run via #3611 and found that the degree to which they differ is vastly different. 

For example, In the case of `CNNClassifer`'s `predict_proba`, the values don't seem to be [very far apart](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3279479559/jobs/5399198702#step:7:1192). 

On the opposite end, we have something like `CNNRegressor`'s `predict`, where the values are [too far off](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3279479559/jobs/5399198702#step:7:1527).

Initially, this test was skipped for all DL estimators. So that's probably why this went undiagnosed for so long.

Edit: This error is also sporadic in nature, ie. it doesn't always fail. This can be seen after checking the new failures after skipping all the problematic estimators [here](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3283046621). This also means that all estimators are affected (which implies probably the source is not from estimators).
